primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The deliverance of the human subject from the ontological captivity of sin through the intervention of Jesus Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: The one who... lays down his life to keep the wolves from destroying the sheep
The law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free
Who will deliver me from this body of death?
set me free from the law of sin and death

zender.identificatie: God (The source of the Law and the Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: Thanks be to God through Jesus Christ our Lord!
Paul is speaking for the whole lot of us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the helpless Receiver/Captive.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / The Sacraments
tekstueel_bewijs: May the Holy Spirit give me something to say
here is drink indeed, the bread and wine and Word
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who acts through these means.
helper.rol_van_geest: External power that sets the captive free.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Law of Sin / The Carnivorous Wolf / Death
tekstueel_bewijs: another law at war with the law of my mind
making me captive to the law of sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a bad habit but a 'law' and a 'captivity' that renders the human subject powerless.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to 'feed the wolf' (moral self-improvement).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer ('You')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is introduced only to be proven impossible (failed competence), necessitating the primary program of grace.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Holy Spirit → Jesus Christ ← Law of Sin/Death
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Jesus Christ → Freedom for the Captive

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Good Shepherd... lays down his life
The law of the Spirit... has set me free
God through Jesus Christ our Lord
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I find it to be a law
we have no power of ourselves

voorbeelden: You want to do the right thing
when I want to do right
we have no power of ourselves to help ourselves

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon centers on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (ability) despite the presence of 'Vouloir' (will), concluding that 'Pouvoir' must come from an external Subject (Christ).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S1 (desire), moves to S2 (realization of captivity), rejects ~S2 (self-feeding), and is rescued by S1 (Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by a 'Subject-switch': Christ does what the 'Wretched Man' cannot.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'body of death' and 'captivity'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses a moralistic folk tale as a hook, it systematically deconstructs it to show that humans cannot 'feed the wolf,' pointing instead to Christ as the only active Subject of deliverance.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You want to do the right thing, don't you?

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: we have no power of ourselves to help ourselves

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the active Subject of rescue
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used not as a model of virtue to follow, but as a model of wretchedness and need for grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading of Paul's struggle.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude; shift from self-reliance to Christ-reliance.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic deliverance: salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon uses the 'Two Wolves' story as a foil to highlight the Gospel's radical difference from moralism.
spanning_punten: The tension between the Cherokee's advice (Feed the wolf) and Cranmer's theology (No power to help ourselves).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: keep the wolves from destroying the sheep; set me free from captivity

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit bestows the 'Pouvoir' (Power) that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'law' and a 'captivity' that cannot be overcome by the human spirit.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is purely theocentric. The human subject is correctly identified as 'incompetent' (wretched), and Christ is the 'Subject' of the rescue.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: The balance is appropriate for a Lenten/Soteriological sermon.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Maintain the emphasis on the 'External Word' as the source of power.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death) is already presented as an insurmountable cosmic force.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Program 1) is the foundation; Ethics (Program 2) is shown to be impossible without it.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in subverting moralistic storytelling (the Cherokee tale) to proclaim the radicality of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Two Wolves' metaphor; Greimas shows that the metaphor is actually a 'false actantial path' used to highlight the true Subject (Christ).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 7; Greimas shows how the sermon makes the hearer inhabit the 'Wretched Man' role to receive the 'Object' of grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch'—moving the burden of action from the hearer to the Good Shepherd.

volledige_subject_lijst: Law of sin makes me captive
appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 'Wretched Man' as a universal actant for the human condition.
